decoworld.model.map

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoworld.model.map.Map

  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a single instance of a Map, within a greater World. At present, a Map object is immutable. In future, the following exceptions will be made: - Tiles within 'tiles' may change, however the size and location of the array will not. - TileEntities in 'tileEntities' (when added) may change internally, however the tileEntities array itself will not change.

      int getWidth()
      Returns the width of the map, in tiles.
      boolean isInstanced()
      Returns true if the current map is instanced (unique to each user) or false if this map is global (shared among all users).

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the map, in tiles. This will be greater than zero.
        Returns:
        the width of the map, in tiles.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the map, in tiles. This will be greater than zero.
        Returns:
        the height of the map, in tiles.

      • getTemplateName

        public java.lang.String getTemplateName()
        Returns the template name for the map. This will NOT be null or empty. This name is restricted to containing characters in the range a-z, 0-9 or '_'. This is always lower case.
        Returns:
        the unique name for this map.

      • getFriendlyName

        public java.lang.String getFriendlyName()
        Returns the user-readable name of the map. This will NOT be null. There is no guarantee of uniqueness across map instances.
        Returns:
        the user-readable name of the map.

      • getUniqueName

        public java.lang.String getUniqueName()
        Returns the unique name of the map. This will NOT be null or empty.
        Returns:
        the unique name of the map.

      • isInstanced

        public boolean isInstanced()
        Returns true if the current map is instanced (unique to each user) or false if this map is global (shared among all users).
        Returns:
        true if the current map is unique to each user; otherwise, false.

      • getInstancedUserId

        public int getInstancedUserId()
        If this map is instanced, returns the userId of the user who owns the instanced version of the map. Otherwise this function returns -1.
        Returns:
        the userId to which this Map belongs if it is instanced; otherwise, -1.

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int x,
           int y)
        Returns the Tile at the specified position. This will return the same tile object if two positions have the same type of tile.
        Parameters:
        x - The zero-based x-coordinate.
        y - The zero-based y-coordinate.
        Returns:
        the Tile at the specified position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if x or y parameters are invalid given the map bounds.
